    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
On a highly anticipated match day at the Santiago Bernabéu, Real Madrid demonstrated their dominance over Almeria, securing a comprehensive 3-0 victory. From the first whistle to the final moments, Real Madrid showcased their intent and authority on the pitch, leaving Almeria struggling to keep up. The match, filled with various stoppages and tactical plays, truly highlighted the strategic prowess and relentless energy of the home team.

From the onset, Real Madrid seemed poised and ready to take control. The kick-off was initiated by Real Madrid, immediately setting the tempo for an engaging first half. Within the first minute, the ball went out of play, which allowed Real Madrid to quickly regain composure with a throw-in. However, it wasn't long before the match saw its first foul, committed by Almeria at around the 2-minute mark. This resulted in an indirect free-kick for Real Madrid, an opportunity they were keen to leverage.

Real Madrid's offensive approach was evident, with their first attempt at goal coming just shy of the four-minute mark. Despite the effort being off target, it was clear they were gearing up for an aggressive pursuit of goals. Almeria managed a timely clearance shortly after, attempting to nullify Madrid's growing dominance. Yet, the rhythm of the game was constantly interrupted, with multiple instances of the ball going out of play, resulting in several throw-ins and goal kicks.

As the match progressed, fouls became a recurring theme. Real Madrid committed a foul at the 5:39 mark, and Almeria quickly followed with their own infractions. These frequent fouls disrupted the flow but also highlighted the competitive nature of the encounter. Almeria's indirect free-kick around the 6th minute was a brief opportunity for them to forge something substantial, but Madrid's defense remained solid.

Real Madrid’s persistence eventually paid off. A series of corners were awarded to them, indicating their continuous pressure on Almeria’s defense. By the time the clock hit the 18th minute, multiple fouls by Almeria had given Real Madrid opportunities through indirect free-kicks. The game was characterized by numerous interruptions, including throw-ins and goal kicks, further emphasizing the high-energy and slightly fragmented nature of the first half.

The defining moment of the first half occurred just before the break. At the 43rd minute, Real Madrid meticulously constructed an attacking play, culminating in a shot on target that found the back of the net. This goal was the much-awaited breakthrough, sending the Bernabéu into a roar of triumph as Real Madrid took a 1-0 lead just as the first half was winding down. The goal typified their offensive strategy: relentless, patient, and ultimately rewarding.

The second half saw Almeria attempting to regroup and make a stronger start. Their kick-off marked the beginning of another gruelling 45 minutes, and they found themselves immediately under pressure. Within the first few minutes, Almeria had to deal with another ball going out of play and a Real Madrid corner. Real Madrid wasted no time in doubling their lead, with a goal soon after the corner. The goal was a statement of intent, giving Real Madrid a solid 2-0 advantage and further demoralizing the visitors.

Almeria’s efforts to claw their way back into the game were evident but largely ineffective. Their throw-ins and few offensive forays often ended without a significant threat to Madrid's defense. By the 10th minute of the second half, Almeria had committed another foul, resulting in multiple set-piece opportunities for Real Madrid. These moments highlighted Real Madrid’s superior tactical execution and set-piece proficiency.

As the game neared the hour mark, both teams made several substitutions, perhaps seeking fresh legs and new strategies to change the course of the match. Almeria’s substitutes aimed to inject some much-needed energy into their ranks, while Real Madrid’s changes appeared more tactical, maintaining their dominant posture. The continuous play interruptions due to fouls, throw-ins, and clearances slightly tempered the match’s pace but did little to alter Madrid's control over the proceedings.

Almeria's resistance slipped again as Real Madrid continued their offensive onslaught. Multiple corners in quick succession displayed Madrid's robust strategy and their ability to keep Almeria pinned in their defensive third. Despite Almeria’s numerous clearances and attempts to push forward, they struggled to string together convincing attacks. The ball repeatedly went out of play, resulting in numerous throw-ins which contributed to the stop-start nature of the game.

In the latter stages, Real Madrid capped their dominant performance with a spectacular third goal. At the 38:55 mark of the second half, Real Madrid capitalized on their pressure, scoring another goal. This final strike solidified their victory and extinguished any residual hopes of an Almeria comeback. The goal was a testament to their relentless pursuit and clinical finishing.

Even in the waning moments of the match, Real Madrid continued to showcase their superior ball control and tactical awareness. Although Almeria managed a few sporadic shots, none posed a significant threat to Madrid’s well-organized defense. Real Madrid, maintaining composure and discipline, saw out the remaining minutes comfortably. The final few minutes highlighted Madrid's ability to control the game’s tempo, even when comfortably ahead. 

The match concluded with a dominant 3-0 victory for Real Madrid, a result that truly reflected their control, skill, and tactical supremacy on the day. Almeria, despite their best efforts, found themselves outclassed in almost every department. The match statistics underscored Madrid's superiority, with multiple shots on and off target, numerous corners, and strategic set-pieces that Almeria struggled to cope with.

Overall, Real Madrid's performance was a masterclass in strategic football, marked by relentless pressure, efficient ball control, and clinical finishing. Their ability to capitalize on set-pieces and maintain defensive solidity ensured a well-deserved victory. This match not only highlighted Real Madrid's strengths but also served as a reminder of the intense competition within the league. Fans left the Bernabéu thoroughly entertained, looking forward to the next demonstration of their team's prowess on the pitch.
